clues.text: This fabric used in coats usually comes from the Bactrian type
A fabric made from this tall grass is all the rage in part due to its antibacterial properties
This lace named for a town in France was paired in song with "a pretty face and a ponytail hanging down"
This woven fabric used for suits sounds like a poetic contraction referencing the future
Sails & beach umbrella are 2 items traditionally made of this hempen or flaxen cloth
Van Gogh's "Self-Portrait with Pipe and Bandaged ____"
Jonathan Buttall is thought to be Gainsborough's model for "The ____ Boy"
Seurat got to the point in "A ____ Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte"
Duchamp caused a scandal with his "Nude Descending a ____, No. 2"
Dali gave it a name that stuck: "The Persistence of ____"

A sari wearer:
HI, GRAND INDIA!

In Italy:
VIRILE SLOB COUSIN

Uh oh! Panama!:
GENUINE AMORAL

He Laboured over Britain:
BRAINY LOT

Late Israeli leader:
SOLAR HERNIA
This Christian sacrament, a holy ceremony, is also called Eucharist
A ceremony on November 19, 1863 dedicated a cemetery in this town
Vice presidents are often sent to this type of ceremony overseas; Al Gore attended Mitterrand's in 1996
Giant scissors are mainly used for this type of ceremony at the grand opening of a new facility
An accolade, a ceremonial tap on the shoulder with a sword, is followed by the words "I dub thee" this
This title character of a Coleridge poem must wander the world recounting the tale of his days at sea
Keats was inspired to write an ode to this bird by the song of one that nested in Charles Brown's garden
After part of "Childe Harold's Pilgrimage" was published, this lord "awoke one morning and found myself famous"
His first major work was "The Lay of the Last Minstrel", a poem set on & north of England's northern border
The play in verse about this Greek god "Unbound" is often regarded as Shelley's greatest work
To mark a product incorrectly
William Blackstone called it "the great and efficacious writ, in all manner of illegal confinement"
A young pine or fir stem tossed in Highland Games
This word for the science of baseball analytics comes from the name of a research society
Early scientific instrument used to measure the altitude of celestial objects
In Acts 9 Paul gets a call from the Lord near this Syrian city
Paul & Barnabas preached to big crowds in Antioch, where Acts 11 says the Disciples were first called these
Paul's New Testament letters include 2 to these Greeks who gave their name to an order of classical architecture
The lord calls Paul a "chosen vessel... to bear my name before" these non-Jews
Paul was born Saul in this Asia minor city around 4 B.C.
Belizeans enjoy a midnight mass & hearing "They came with haste, and found" these 2 "and the babe lying in a manger"
Belize celebrates this Dec. 26 holiday, so I'll make a charitable donation & get something nice for Jeeves
Christmas dinner may include this banana relative; belize.com reports it's said to be "the local cranberry sauce"
The "Deer Dance" of this Yucatan civilization is done at Xmas in Belize to show the relationship between humanity & nature
Time to Christmas shop in this city--it became the capital in 1970, when Belize was still a British dependency
In 1909 this French engineer built a type of wind tunnel that "towered" above all others
At age 16 he got the idea for his revolver observing a ship's wheel on a voyage
On August 4, 1922 the telephone systems of the U.S. & Canada were silent for 1 minute in tribute to this late inventor
While at an auto body shop in the 1920s, 3M engineer Richard Drew came up with the idea for this type of tape to help the painters
In 1899 this man equipped ships with wireless tech so they could report on the America's Cup to a NYC newspaper
This 1952 Steinbeck novel tells the stories of 3 generations of the Trask & Hamilton families
1884's "Star of the South" was an Africa-set novel in this French sci-fi pioneer's "Extraordinary Voyages" series
Homer Simpson is a character in this author's "The Day of the Locust"
"South" is this explorer's account of his efforts from 1914 to 1917 to become the first man to cross Antarctica
Robert Frost published the collection "North of" this city in 1914
This R. Kelly song was written for Michael Jordan's "Space Jam"
This Paul Simon song laments, "I am shielded in my armor, hiding in my room, safe within my womb"
Beyonce (not Kilroy) sang this Diane Warren-penned hit for World Humanitarian Day in 2012
"Not even the chair" heard Neil Diamond when he made this title song declaration
Bob Geldof wrote this song after hearing young Brenda Spencer's motive for a 1979 school shooting
"Medical aid where it is needed most. Independent, neutral, impartial" is a slogan of this medical assistance group
This organization that builds & repairs houses for low-income families can be reached at 1-800-the first word in its name
In 2007 he was commemorated on an Australian postage stamp with proceeds going to his Wildlife Warriors charity
Improving the quality of life for the blind & visually impaired since 1946, a N.Y. foundation provides these free of charge
In 1739 Thomas Coram set up a London hospital for orphans called these, like Fielding's Tom Jones

rounds.text: From a Sanskrit word for "descent", it's the form a god takes upon descending to Earth
